heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 09 November 2025, the storm lasted 144.8 hours with a total precipitation of 47.89mm and it reached 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 0 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (213°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.0 mm).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 82.4m higher than yesterday, 6.4m lower than the past week, 19.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 557m to a maximum of 849m, averaging 754.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 760.4m and 773.2m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and very little to no wind will be present. Showers, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and the light is absent. Changeable conditions.
